Great staple diner,
Excellent food with fast efficient service.
Seinfeld lol
Seinfeld craz is long past gone. Now it's just a diner st the corner. Where you can wait at the counter for a man to pour your coffee

You get the classic american diner experience here. Prices are friendly despite the Seinfeld fame, and there were no tourist group gatherings outside. Reasonably quick service even at the busiest of times.

Points off for the restrooms, which seem to be â€œmomentarily out of orderâ€ - permanently.
I had three big salad just like Elaine. Finn place to eat. Staff was fantastic

My order from uber eats of the chicken wrap with bacon with the fries and a pickle was delicious.  It was made well and very fresh.  I was very happy with my purchase.
Very solid diner. Great atmosphere with quick and delicious food

I had a late lunch here. I think many people come for the experience, as the exterior was used as the site of the restaurant in Seinfeld. It is a fun New York joint with people packed in and a lot of yelling. You really need to come and be a part of history.I had coffee (why is diner coffee so bad), one fried egg, toast, potatoes, and hash for $17, which is pretty good for NYC prices.

I had medium expectations, I thought it would just be a gimmick because it's the Seinfeld restaurant. But the food was awesome. I had a bacon omelette. The breakfast potatoes are bomb. It's a nice atmosphere and the service was great.

Stop in looking forward to a nice Diner breakfast, I was told there wasnâ€™t anymore booth available when I walked in but a couple had got up from the booth and left I asked the unprofessional Quote unquote Manager can I sit at the booth, with the loudest meanest voice he said â€œNOâ€ and walked away, the customer be side me looked at me than said to him, so youâ€™re the owner, he said yeah why, the customer began talking about Seinfeld and once again he walked away. This manager with a nasty attitude, really should be in the back counting numbers, he has the slightest idea how to be kind and respectful to the people that keeps this restaurant running. So whom ever is the actual owner of this restaurant, come and check in every now and then because I left without eating, I donâ€™t have to take that from no one, and reading some of these reviews,  and this place has left a bad taste in a few peopleâ€™s mouths.

If you're a Seinfeld fan, just take a selfie in front of the exterior; that is guaranteed to be the highlight of your experience.

Inattentive staff and terrible food. I got the meatloaf sandwich with fries, as it was on the daily special menu, so I supposed that it would both fresh and good. Wrong on both counts! Three bacon-thin slices of "meatloaf" with some unidentifiable watery sauce on a surprisingly decent roll, and hands-down the blandest fries I've ever eaten. Who doesn't salt their fries?!

The price wouldn't have been awful, except that the food was.

I absolutely love this restaurant! Everything moves pretty fast, I love Seinfeld and the food is incredibly tasty every time! Some characters work there, but most discrepancies are easily dealt with and are worth the food, 100%. Ive gotten breakfast items and lunch/dinner items and I can never wait to go back. I love an excuse to go to Monk's.... I mean Tom's.. (seinfeld joke.) 10/10, highly recommend.
Everything you want from a true American classic dinner . Enjoyed it very much .

Si viste la serie Seinfeld, sabes que es un lugar icÃ³nico, si bien por dentro no es como en la serie, sÃ­ se pueden ver fotos y autÃ³grafos de los protagonistas y el ambiente es el tÃ­pico de Diner de USA.
Fuimos para un brunch con mi hermano y la verdad que quedamos encantados. Comida rÃ¡pida y riquisima!
Iconic.
Great Place!! The bar tenders are incredibles. Good food and Seinfeld spirits
My first time here and I love the service. The tea is one of my favorite things, very clean inside and out.

One of the bucket list locations during my vacation due to Seinfeld.
The manager there was such a friendly and talkative person to everyone that came in.
He even went out of his way to go downstairs to see if they had a Seinfeld t-shirt in a large. Unfortunately they never however was worth dropping in!
Went here a week ago with my mom. Had no idea it was famous but loved the service, food and atmosphere!
Really great place with delicious food, and atmosphere.
Itâ€™s ok, nothing to write home about unless youâ€™re a Seinfeld fan.

Iconic from its inclusion in Seinfeld- Tomâ€™s restaurant interior isnâ€™t actually anything like the show sadly, but they do have a great and diverse breakfast and lunch menu served all day, and itâ€™s very reasonable!
I will visit New York one and I will literally shout out loud like some idiot shouting WHERES JERRY SEINFELD (while drinking pistachio milkshake)
If youâ€™re looking for a place to eat nostalgically about Seinfeld, this is a good option. The food is acceptable, the service was bearable, and the vibe definitely feels Seinfeldy.

Bir Jerry Seinfeld kahvaltÄ±sÄ± olmazsa olmazdÄ±: Peynirli ve domatesli bir omlet ve yanÄ±nda kahve. Belki ilk defa New York'tayÄ±m ama Kramer, Jerry, Elaine ve George saÄŸ olsun Ã§okÃ§a anÄ± biriktirmiÅŸim sayelerinde :)
Our favorite late night breakfast joint in NY! Definitely recommend ğŸ‘Œ Great service,  food ,and atmosphere.  Especially if you're a Seinfeld fan.
Great food! Great vibes! Classic dinner
This place was amazing!

I love Toms! If you need a juicy burger and shake, this is your place to go. Iâ€™ve seen some poor reviews talking about some of the food they got not being up to snuff. I would recommend sticking to diner classics. Pancakes, breakfast foods and shakes. If you do that, youâ€™ll have a fantastic meal that will fill you right up! The Broadway Shake (Coffee and chocolate syrup) is to die for!!!

as a die-hard seinfeld fan, iâ€™m very happy to have seen this place in my last visit to the nyc. itâ€™s right around the columbia university and super easy to access. food was delish, but a bit expensive.

This was a place Iâ€™ve wanted to go since I was a young girl watching the show with my dad! Really happy I got to dine here but the experience was slightly overshadowed by the one server. We had a really nice young man serving us originally. Food was slightly above average for breakfast diner food. He gave us the bill and my partner wanted to pay that (so he put down some cash) and I wanted to tip.. we hadnâ€™t finished our iced coffees when this woman scooped up the bill, along with his cash then came back slammed down the bill with a couple coins and rudely said tip wasnâ€™t included in the bill while stomping away. We couldnâ€™t even explain that that was my part I like to pay when we dine out. We werenâ€™t finished and I was the one who wanted to tip!! Really embarrassing and not the best way to end such a cool experience. I had 10 dollars I wanted to give the young man serving us. She then stood and glared at us until we left, it was pretty uncomfortable and bizarre!
iconic spot

â€œHiÃ§bir ÅŸey hakkÄ±nda bir diziâ€ sloganÄ± ile genÃ§lik dÃ¶nemlerimizin efsane dizisi Seinfeld.  Jerry ve Georgeâ€™un yemek yerken geyiklerini yaptÄ±klarÄ± gÃ¶rseli meÅŸhur restoran. Yemekler idare eder. Ama orada bulunmak gerÃ§ekten keyifli. Ä°Ã§erisi Seinfeld karakterlerinin fotolarÄ±yla dolu.
Delicious restaurant, the famous salad is delicious, now I understand why it is so famous!

Good diner food, fast and efficient service, although the place can get very busy.
Itâ€™s in close proximity to the Columbia University campus. Not open during the night.
This diner was featured from the outside on the Seinfeld show. Quite the NYC landmark.

We did all the fun tourist things and this was great, we love Seinfeld so this was a must stop.  Food was great and our server at the bar was soo much fun, he made the trip worth it.  The food was great and the prices were too.

We kwamen binnen als Seinfeld fan en gingen buiten als Tom fan!
Een authentiek interieur, lekker eten en vriendelijke bediening.
Genoten van ons avondje uit!

It was great to be in the restaurant where Seinfiled was shot. Food was good and service was Amazing. They do t have a/c just fyi for hot summer days. Or at least they donâ€™t have it one when we are there in early August!

The driest chicken Iâ€™ve eaten in my life. Had to get it down with water like it was a saltine cracker.

Iâ€™ve been in New York for the better part of a year and this is the worst restaurant food Iâ€™ve had. They did provide a piece of cheesecake for my friends momâ€™s birthday which was nice of them so that earned them a second star.

I got the restaurant recommendation:
Salad, Rosemary Chicken with roasted potatoes and Chicken noodles soup.
Every was bad.
The salad was awful because of the dressing (a thick vinegar salty dressing).
The Chicken was whatever and I don't think the potatoes were roasted... maybe boiled. And the chicken soup tasted like a canned chicken noodle soup.
In the must visit list of NYC

the "assorted muffins" option on the menu is really just one huge cornbread muffin with some grape jelly that tasted quite delectable
